title: [Large-Scale] Independent Curriculum Physics E-Module Development Project

context.prior_knowledge: Middle school-level foundational physics concepts (force, motion, energy, etc.)
context.additional_context: Students self-direct learning on an LMS platform via personal devices, participate in weekly asynchronous discussion sessions, and complete project-based assignments applying physics concepts to real-life problem-solving.

learning_goals: Students can explain core physics concepts (Newtonian mechanics, waves, electromagnetism) with over 80% accuracy using self-directed learning strategies.
Learners can analyze physics phenomenon simulations using interactive content within e-modules and connect them to three or more real-world applications.
Students can share weekly learning reviews with peer learners via the LMS discussion board and provide at least five instances of constructive feedback.

resources: Automated Grading System for Formative Assessments

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
